fields.headline: It's a man thing
fields.bodyText: New faces If worrying about getting old or the stress and strain of city life are showing all over your face, do something about it at One Spa which specialises in rejuvenating square jaws and stiff upper lips. Facials from £42. ·One Spa, Sheraton Grand Hotel, Edinburgh (0131-221 7777, one-spa.com) Mr muscles Too many people wait until they're doubled over in pain before they see a physiotherapist. But minor complaints - poor posture and muscle ache, for example - can be treated too. Esporta health club at The Light in Leeds offers a physio service alongside a gym, massage, facials and spray tanning. Initial consultation £35, follow-up treatments £30. · Esporta, The Light, Leeds (thelightleeds.co.uk, peakphysiotherapy.com, 0113 2337500) Fancy footwork Let's face it - it takes a very devoted partner to pay attention to a man's feet, so the suitably macho sounding Sports Pedicure £28) could be a good investment. · Obsession Salon and Spa at The Mailbox, Birmingham (0121-665 4600, obsessionsalonspa.co.uk). Also at Obsession, Lichfield, and the De Vere Belfry Hotel, Warwickshire. Close shave For the ultimate in men's grooming, have a wet shave at the oldest barbershop in the world (heading for its 200th anniversary) - badger-bristle brushes, unctuous shaving creams and cut-throats Sweeney Todd would kill for. A traditional hot-towel wet shave costs £35. · Truefitt & Hill, St James's, London (020-7493 2961, truefittandhill.co.uk) Fine and dandy The grooming emporium that thinks it's a gentlemen's club, Pankhurst offers haircuts, shaves and manicures in classic salubrious surroundings. Prolong your visit with a relaxing drink, watch one of the private TV screens and choose yourself a fat Corona from the adjacent Dunhill humidor and you'll be quite the dandy. Shaves cost from £35, a haircut from £45. · Pankhurst at Alfred Dunhill, Jermyn Street, London (020-7290 8636, dunhill.com)
